distribution_native_art_desc: Abuta limaciifolia is primarily native to the tropical regions of South America, specifically Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. It is well adapted to the warm and humid climate of these regions. Its native range is largely confined to the western part of the Amazon basin.
